Welcome to dominanceoptimizers’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class domopt.Point(x, f)¶

Object for storing designs in optimization. It can be called as a tuple, corresponding to (x, f)

Parameters:
  • x (list) – Object representing the design that the optimization manipulates, i.e. scaled design variables
  • f (object) – Object that measures performance, it must have the < and == operators defined.
class domopt.Stochastic(design=None, samples=None, stype='MV')¶

Represents an design’s performance through stochastic samples

FSDcompare(design, other)¶

Compares two designs for first order stochastic dominance using the empirical quantile function for comparison.

MVcompare(design, other)¶

Compares designs using Pareto dominance using the sample mean and standard deviation

SSDcompare(design, other)¶

Compares two designs for first order stochastic dominance using the empirical superquantile function for comparison.

ZSDcompare(design, other)¶

Compares two designs for zeroth order stochastic dominance using the minimum and maximum of the samples.

class domopt.GeneticAlgorithm(evaluator, bounds, population_size=100, max_generations=50, verbose=False)¶

Evolutionary computation representing the nondominated sorting genetic algorithm under uncertainty.

Parameters:
  • evaluator (function) – Function that takes a vector of design variables and returns an object that can be compared via < and == operators.
  • bounds (list) – List of bounds on design variables in the form [(l0, u0), (l1, u1), ..., (ln, un)] where lb, uk are the lower and upper bounds on the kth design variable respectively.
optimize(seeds=[])¶

Performs the genetic algorithm optimization.

Parameters:seeds (list) – List of initial design vectors to use as seeds in the optimization. Only the first population_size will be used.
Returns:Archive of non-dominated points obtained by the optimization.
Return type:List of Point objects
class domopt.TabuSearch(evaluator, bounds, max_points=200, verbose=False, search_method='exhaustive')¶

Tabu search for non-dominance based optimization.

Parameters:
  • evaluator (function) – Function that takes a vector of design variables and returns an object that can be compared via < and == operators.
  • bounds (list) – List of bounds on design variables in the form [(l0, u0), (l1, u1), ..., (ln, un)] where lb, uk are the lower and upper bounds on the kth design variable respectively.
optimize(dv0, verbose=None, restart_data=None)¶

Performs the genetic algorithm optimization.

Parameters:dv0 (list) – Initial design vector
Returns:Archive of non-dominated points obtained by the optimization.
Return type:List of Point objects
class domopt.Optimization(evaluator, bounds)¶

Base class for optimziations operating on Point objects.

Designs are stored as Point objects - the first entry is what the optimizer controls (i.e. scaled design variables), the second entry is an object provided obtained by the evaluator method that measures performance, it must have a comparison operator.

This generalization allows any comparison operator to be defined and thus general non-dominance criteria to be used.

The optimizer scales the design variables to range over [0,10] so that an algorithm’s methods operate over an appropriate scaled space.

Parameters:
  • evaluator (function) – function that takes a list of design variables (that are contained within the bounds) and returns an object that must have the comparison operators < and ==
  • bounds (list) – list of bounds on the design variables in the form [(l0, u0), (l1, u1), ..., (ln, un)], where li and ui are the lower and upper bounds on the ith design variable.
